item.title: Zero-knowledge Proofs
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Zero-knowledge proof is a way of proving the validity of a statement without disclosing the statement itself. A “validator” is the party attempting to prove a claim, while a “verifier” is responsible for validating the claim.
